aboutme.description: Rajarshi Chattopadhyay is a System Engineer at IBM Client Innovation Centre, India, where he is currently serving as Application Developer in Distribution sector - Shipping domain. He currently works in the areas of Web App Development, Data mining and Analysis. He was intern at Bharat Sanchar Nigam Ltd. and SIEMENS Metal technologies, where he worked on Computer Networking and Automation respectively. He also worked part-time at Hi-Q Solutions, India on embedded systems. Rajarshi received his Bachelor of Technology degree in Electronics and Communication Engineering from West Bengal University of Technology (WBUT), Kolkata, India. His cross disciplinary research interests lie in areas of Big Data mining and analysis, Applied Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence in Embedded Systems and Internet-of-Things.

ugrad.univ: West Bengal University of Technology, Kolkata
ugrad.subject: Electronics and Communication Engineering

job.responsibilities: Application Developement, Data mining, Data analysis, Database maintenance, Automation
Embedded product programming, designing and development

project.name: Kinship Tool
project.description: Twitter data mining and development of model to find out the most related words (kin) to a word/phrase used in tweets.

project.name: Automation of Message Queue Reporting
project.description: Development of automated MQ status reporting job and setting up the same in Cron.

project.name: Automation of Message Queue Monitoring
project.description: Development of automated MQ status monitoring job and setting up the same in Cron.

project.name: Application-Interface Message Statistics Tool
project.description: Development of Bash shell Script, Windows GUI, and Web Application to mine application logs and extract data to calculate statistics of application – interface message exchange.

project.name: RISC Processor based on Harvard Architecture
project.description: Design and development of a 16-bit customized Reduced Instruction Set Processor based on Harvard Architecture, that incorporates both Operation Code and Data within 16 bits, and implementation of the same with minimum area in FPGA.

project.name: Bootable Microcontroller (8051) board with optional ROM
project.description: Design and development of a microcontroller panel which can be used to directly program a microcontroller without the need to write and burn the monitor program on a ROM separately; Owner of the intellectual property of the prototype.

project.name: College Network
project.description: Design a college network for connecting institutes present in three isolated locations using a pre-defined pool of IP address (IPV4), and implement using NetSim (Network Simulator).

project.name: Automatic Pump Controller
project.description: Design and develop an embedded system comprising of a controller, which can be connected to sensors that detect fluid level in a container, and accordingly switch motor ON/OFF based on fluid level.

paper.author: Rajarshi Chattopadhyay, Sagnik Raha and Rabindranath Sarkar
paper.title: Design, development and prototyping of Bootable MCS-51 Board having optional ROM
paper.detail: Product development on behalf of Hi-Q Solutions

paper.author: Rajarshi Chattopadhyay, Sagnik Raha and Rabindranath Sarkar
paper.title: Development of 16-bit RISC processor with Harvard architecture and implementation utilizing minimum area on FPGA
